title: Best public pools in Canada [Photos]
text:
By Nicole Feenstra , Postmedia Network First posted: Wednesday, July 15, 2015 08:00 AM EDT Best public pools in Canada Previous Next 
Sunnyside-Gus Ryder pool, Toronto: This outdoor public pool is one of the largest pools in the city and a hot spot to be once the weather turns warm. Located on Lakeshore Blvd. West, the pool also offers scenic views of Lake Ontario. (Postmedia Network/Jack Boland) 
Riverdale Pool, Toronto: Located in Riverdale Park, along Toronto's Lower Don River, this outdoor swimming pool is a great spot to cool down and swim some laps with the family or with friends this summer. (Postmedia Network/Ernest Doroszuk) 
World Waterpark at West Edmonton Mall, Edmonton: The indoor waterpark at West Edmonton Mall certainly provides a unique water experience for families looking to cool down this summer. World Waterpark features the world's largest indoor wave pool, 17 water slides and other quirky activities. (Brendon Dlouhy/Postmedia Network) 
Revelstoke Aquatic Centre, British Columbia: This ultra mod indoor facility, designed by the MC Group, is equipped with a water slide, lazy river, a whirlpool and a salt-water Olympic-sized pool. (Courtesy MC Group Construction Firms) 
Bowview Outdoor Pool, Calgary: This outdoor pool offers family fun and activities through the summer, including family pool parties, live music, hot dog barbecues and more. Visit the Hillhurst-Sunnyside Community Association for full details on summer activities at Bowview. (LYLE ASPINALL/Postmedia Network) Lyle Aspinall/Calgary Sun/QMI Ag 
Fun Mountain Waterslide Park, Winnipeg: Winnipeg's Fun Mountain lives up to it's name as a fun family activity on a hot summer day. The park features water slides, a splash pad, hot tub, bumper boats and more. (MARCEL CRETAIN/Postmedia Network) Marcel Cretain / Winnipeg Sun / 
Champagne Fitness Centre pool, Ottawa: Located near Ottawa's famed ByWard Market in a historic downtown building, the indoor public pool at Champagne Fitness Centre is more than 22 metres in size. A sauna is also available on site. (Courtesy Google Street View) 
Parc Sir-Wilfrid-Laurier pool, Montreal: Located in the lovely Parc Sir-Wilfrid-Laurier, this outdoor pool is a favourite summer hang-out in Montreal. (JOEL LEMAY/Postmedia Network) Joel Lemay/Agence QMI 
Second Beach Pool, Vancouver: Located in Vancouver's Stanley Park on the shore of English Bay, the heated, walk-in Second Beach Pool is a great place to cool down this summer. This pool is especially great for families who will appreciate the gentle beach-style entry. ( Wikipedia/Kaveh ) 
Hillcrest Aquatic Centre, Vancouver: The largest indoor/outdoor aquatic facility run by the City of Vancouver, this centre offers swimming lanes, a lazy river, a 70 person hot tub and water cannons in the leisure pool. The Aquatic Centre's adjoining community centre was used during the 2012 Winter Olympics as a curling rink. (Courtesy City of Vancouver) Article
